If chasing the Northern Lights, diving beneath icy lakes and scaling frozen waterfalls sound like your dream activities, then this is the ideal job for you.
Visit Finland and Finnair have launched a campaign in search of a UK explorer for the ultimate polar work experience position - a three month adventure in the arctic conditions of Finnish Lapland.
The unique job advert, which went live today, encourages keen adventurers with aspirations of polar exploration to apply to take part in this once-in-a- lifetime opportunity.

Finns are renowned as the snow and ice professionals of the world and the lucky UK adventurer will become a master of winter skills in order to thrive in the arctic wilderness.
During the three month expedition the team will participate in tailor made polar themes and activities such as climbing frozen waterfalls, diving beneath frozen lakes,an arctic rally and hunting for the elusive Aurora Borealis in the heart of the striking arctic landscape.

Leap of faith: Tens of thousands of Hindu pilgrims take holy... The expedition will be lead by Pasi Ikonen, who has over 10 years experience as a wilderness guide in the harsh environment. Pasi began his career as a border patrol officer and later went on to be a full time athlete; in 2008 he completed an unsupported expedition to the South Pole.
Pasi Ikonen, 100 Days of Polar Night Magic expedition leader, said: 'This is a unique opportunity for an explorer from the UK to apply for a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to spend three months in the arctic circle during the magical and challenging winter season.
One thing is for certain with the job advertised - no two days will be the same in the North Pole
The unique job advert, which went live today, encourages keen adventurers with aspirations of polar exploration to apply
Husky Dogs will become a close ally when you take to the harsh white landscape on the job of a lifetime
Pioneering trailblazer: The position offers a three month adventure learning skills of how to thrive in Finnish Lapland
'Without a doubt this is the ultimate work experience opportunity for any future explorer.'
UK entrants can apply between September 14 and October 19 and a winner will be chosen shortly afterwards.
The expedition will start in December 2015 and end three months later in March 2016. For more information and to apply, visit www.polarnightmagic.com
The lucky UK adventurer will become a master of the winter and the arctic wilderness and will get to ride across the snow in style
Some of the night time activities that have only been seen in books or on TV will now become a reality for one chosen person
UK entrants can apply between September 14 and October 19 and a winner will be chosen shortly afterwards
Don't forget your camera: Stunning views will be the perfect wake up call for the lucky candidate of this unique opportunity
DAY-TO-DAY ACTIVITIES FOR THE CHOSEN POLAR EXPLORER Firefox Blaze Quest – Aurora hunting by skidoo and snowshoe
During the dark winter months when the sun never rises the skies are lit up by the mystical Aurora Borealis. During this stage, the team of explorers will be hunting this often elusive phenomena while studying the weather patterns that create one of the most magical sights in the world.
Five-Fells conquest
Moving around the arctic landscape is a challenge to even the most hardened of explorers. This week long stage will be one of the toughest, pulling everything an explorer needs to survive in a sledge behind them, sleeping in tents on the ice and cooking outdoors.
The challenge will be to learning how survive in the treeless fell of Finnish Lapland, with gusting winds, freezing temperatures and variable snow conditions.
The three-month position will throw up its own challenges of travelling through the bleak landscape and tumultuous weather conditions
Arctic rally on ice and snow
Exploring the arctic landscape does not have to be a slow process, Finns are famous for their winter driving kills producing some of the best rally drivers in the world. This stage will teach the explorers how to drive at speed in the harshest of winter environments, including spinning and drifting through bends.
Climbing the frozen waterfalls
The explorers will be taken to the Korouoma Nature Reserve and taught techniques in scaling some of the world’s most challenging frozen waterfalls. The ever changing conditions provide an exciting adventure for even the most seasoned of climbers.
